content: It's the worst app going. It's not the colour I use which is dark blue. Trying to turn on to have the overlay on screen is rediculous. It let's you reset but won't turn on. I really do regret paying for the app even iff it is only 1.99. ðŸ˜”

However, after a few moments (maybe about a minute) the overlay effect stops and I have to select apply again in the app. Very disappointed my phone may be too old to use the app, but more convinced I should see an Irlen specialist.

It only stays up for like 2 minutes before it goes away.

Everyone who has problems with app read this. If you cant read the text with the overlay, change your phone font or font size in settings. If the overlay won't stay on, you must give it permission to appear on top of other apps in your settings. All issues mentioned in bad reviews are easy fixes. You can' contact me for more info at my instagram @nicpyro

However, I was able to get an idea of what colour suited me and I refunded it (must be within first two hours, I think) so three stars for being mildly helpful and allowing a refund.
horrible i cant see what im reading it fogy everytime i tried to use it on different cell phones and tablets.
the overlay doesn't stay on. it will work for a 3 minutes until i have to turn it back on again. kind of a pain if I'm reading an article. please fix this.

crashes constantly. not worth the price. a real disappointment!!! Refund

I want a refund, you only have a dozen colours to choose from and the custom option is completely misleading because you can still only use those colours to make another colour. when you pay for an app you expect it to offer more than the other free apps do.
it is nice to be able to look at my screen without worrying ab out geting a migrain.

I would love to have an Irlen filter over my screen without having to use a cling.  Yes, I have Irlen lenses and my daughter does as well.  I have also ordered a cling.  I need additional tinting on screens, but wouldn't want my glasses so dark for everyday activities in all light settings.  I change the background color in word, but with other programs, I am limited.  Thanks again!

My phone says it has a virus and won't install it. Such a bummer.
When I click to install the app I'm having a message pop up on my phone saying the app contains a virus and to uninstallâ€‹ the app immediately.
Amazing app. Simple to use and it definitely helps with my irlens!

Used this before and couldn't get it right so never put it on new phone. Now have different color filters on my lenses so thought to try again... But antivirus on my phone (Avast) tells me there is Malware in the code?! Don't know how else to contact Irlen, so hope they read this to fix it. As an Irlen sufferer I am so happy that this app had been developed. I use it on my Wileyfox phone but when I went to install it on my Asus tablet I got a warning starring the app contains Malware that could put my security at risk? Please advise.
When it is working, definitely worth it! It keeps turning off though and I have to continually open the app again to turn it back on which is annoying.
This app was wonderful for the two weeks that it worked.  But it has crashed and now I can't get it to work without paying for it again which I am not willing to do unless I know it will work.
Colored filters minimize light frequencies that are undesirable enabling me to use laptop and mobile device.

This is exactly what I have been looking for. I have Claro on my lap and desk top but hadn't found anything for my phone. I have Irlen associated with dyslexia. I notice another review complain that it overlays black and reduces contrast - but that is exactly what it needs to do. It is the contrast between black and white that causes blurring on letter shapes and eye fatigue. Thanks for making this app. Very reasonable price too.
Good app, but needs a widget button so you can activate it from the home screen, rather than have to load the app
Avast is detecting a Trojan after the installation. Please clarify!
Dims the font. Can't use my color because I can't see through the overlay.
In this day an age of excessive lighting this helps so much. I do get the point Erland is making though.
I've used irlens overlays and glasses for most of my life. The colours in the app aren't as strong as the real page overlays making this app a waste of money.

I think this app is very poor because I had been using it for only two days then it stopped working. I have sent feedback to the developers on three occasions and have received no response or resolution. I feel this unacceptable and very unsatisfactory particularly because you have to pay Â£1.99 for installation. I want a refund of my money. I advise others who have an Android phone to avoid this app and continue searching for a more helpful app to manage the challenges of visual stress.

It relieves my eyes somewhat but it crashes CONSTANTLY and I have to keep turning it back on. Not a wide range of colours. You can't make the screen darker than the phone's settings which is one of the main things I need which a similar app which is free is able to do. I wouldn't be keen on paying for this app when I can get much more from a free app.
A real overlay lets black come through undisturbed. This app clouds the screen, making black into gray and the added color feels disturbing, like a shining mist hovering in front of your eyes.
This app helps so much. Makes my phone much easier to look at. Sometimes the app will turn off when it's not supposed to but I'm okay with that.

I am hoping to find out if a particular color will make my life easier (in a fluorescent office all day).  My only complaint is, the overlay is applied to everything, including the color black as well.  This makes everything lose contrast.  Trying to read on Amazon kindle app, with a strong color makes it very hazy because it lightens the black as well.  Kills the contrast.  Still very much worth the money.
App is great for people who only need a light shade. The more I turn the intensity up on the purple the more it fades the text. I still struggle to read.
Great app...... makes my phone and tablet so much more easy to use and read.... any chance you could make a version for a windows surface?? or computers?
I can customize colors, and find the exact shade that minimizes my double vision. So happy to have found an app that overlays every screen on my device.
Thank you Irlen Ambassadors.
If you get headaches and/or your eye's hurt from looking at your phone/tablet. Get this app and find the color that helps you. It made a world of difference for me.
Error message and wouldn't download. Huge shame as really needed this for my phone
replyContent:
An "error failure to download" message is usually a Google Playstore issue that can generally be resolved with the standard fix below:
- Go to Settings, Applications
- Find the Google Playstore App
- Click "clear data" and "clear cache"
- Clear the cache for the Google Play Services
- Restart device
This generally resolves the download error issue.

content: For those of us that prefer darker colors (my Irlen filters are purple grey purple, real dark) this doesn't do the trick. As you increase the intensity of the overlay your text fades out. I can't get it dark enough to help. I will wait and try it again later.

This is a great app. Stable, well done, and flexible.   My only desire is that it be easier to turn on and off. There is an app called Bluelight Filter (apologies for mentioning another app) that allows the user to control it from the pull down menu. I like the setup of this app more, but the pull down option would make it perfect. Definitely deserves 5 stars otherwise.
I never knew what I was missing I knew that my phone was too bright and I had a hard time typing bow with this app I can see the right way
Can't say enough how great this is.
Such a simple app to use, and such a big difference. The screen is so much more comfortable to look at now.
Discovering I had Irlen was such a life changing experience. Having an app for that is pretty awesome!
